dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: WIDE-EXT. JACK’S HOUSE-AFTERNOON JACK drives up to his house and parks out front of it. He sits there for a few moments. INT. JACK’S CAR - AFTERNOON Jack is looking at himself in the rearview mirror of his It's night time and he looks worn from a long day at the office. EXT. JACK’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON - CONTINUOUS He slowly exits his car, attempting to brush off the stre of the day by plastering on a smile. He walks up the walkway to his house and opens the front door. INT. JACK’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - AFTERNOON - CONTINUOUS The house is dark but candle lit in a sensual and romanti way.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Honey, sorry I'm late! Long but productive day at work! Jack tries to sound positive. A laugh is heard coming fro stairs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kendra, is that you babe? Jack thinks the laugh belongs to his daughter, KENDRA [12 There is no response from upstairs. He notices rose petals on the staircase and starts puttin two and two together. He begins walking up the stairs whi taking off his suit jacket and tie.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hun, you didn’t tell me you got a sitter for Kendra! You really outdid yourself this time. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack reaches the top of the stair case and sees a TV flickering in his daughter’s room behind the slightly aja bedroom door. There is giggling behind the door. Confused, he pushes the bedroom door open only to find hi wife, MARCY, sitting Indian style on the floor wearing a mask made out of the skin from Kendra's face. Sitting next to her is KENDRA, whose face is completely skinned off but still fully functioning, playing with her toys. She turns to look back at her father.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRA
dialogues.text: Come play Doll House with us daddy. The TV makes a loud noise and a 13 flashes on it. Jack's watch displays a 13:13 on it. Suddenly Marcy screams and lunges at Jack violently. Jack falls back trying to avoid his rabid wife. His watch star beeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is breathing heavy. Jack turns to take in his surroundings. He is in a sleeping bag inside of a tent. He begins to remember where he is (on a camping trip with his closest friends). He shakes off the dream and exits the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside of the tent, JOE, TREVOR and QUENTIN are seen hud around a camp fire. They are all drinking beers. They all seem to be in a good mood. Jack approaches the group.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Hey there sleepy head. You want a beer? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: But it’s morning... Quentin tosses him a beer.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Look alive, bud. Jack catches the beer and opens it up. It froths up a lit bit at the top. He takes a sip and sits down next to everyone at the campfire.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Don’t mention it.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: So... where was I?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: The dog had killed the neighbors rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Oh yea. So the dog had killed my neighbor's rabbit. So after I panicked a little, my girl said that we could cover it up. See the neighbors were out of town and they just had this generic white rabbit. So I rushed to the store and got another and put it in the cage. Figured they would be none the wiser. Trevor starts laughing. Encouraged by Trevor’s laugh Joe continues with more excitement. Jack seems to be drifting off.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So that’s not the best part. The best part is, a few days later, Mr. And Mrs. come home. I hear a blood curdling scream, like the wife was being attacked or somethin’. So I rush on over only to find her standing in front of the cage pointing at that damn replacement rabbit and just sobbin. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant grin comes across Quentin’s face. Jack is still shaken from his dream.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: So what happened next?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: I’m gettin to that. So anyways I ask her husband what’s wrong. And he tells me that shes upset cus the rabbit died right before they went on vacation and they buried it, but there it was now just sitting in that cage. Joe, Trevor, and Quentin all start laughing, but Jack is silent.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Ain’t that the craziest story you ever heard?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was even crazier the first time I heard it, on Oprah.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Oprah told my story? How’d she hear it? I don’t remember tellin her nuthin.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: It’s an Urban legend, dumbass. Jack looks down at his wrist and notices that his digital watch reads 13:13. Suddenly Jack becomes a bit uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: But it actually happened to me. Jack jumps into the conversation abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Who messed around with my watch?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What do you mean? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Someone changed it to army time and set the wrong time on it.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Ain’t no body messed with your watch there, sleeping beauty. Joe, Quentin, and Trevor laugh. Jack is visually displeas

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s not 13:13. Who messed with my watch?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Jack no one touched your damn watch. Why’s it matter anyway? Just change it back. Anyways Joe, your story has been told a thousand times.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Fuck you Quentin. Jack looks upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Joe, Quentin, and Trevor are packing up the packing gear into Quentin’s car. Jack is a little out of it. He didn’t sleep much last nig

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Come on guys! Get the lead out.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Well maybe if you got off your high horse and carried more this would be done quicker.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: He has a point, Quentin.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Hey man, ya’ll gotta work now, I gotta work later. After its all packed up you guys get to rest for a while and I have to drive.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: I would gladly drive. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Not an option. Joe stuffs some camping gear into the trunk of the car.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: There’s only a little bit left. Let’s just get it done while the princess gets his beauty rest. Quentin turns and looks at Jack who is doing nothing.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Jack what are you doing? Jack looks up at Quentin.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sorry buddy. I just kind of zoned out. I didn’t really sleep last night. Quentin laughs. He steps down from his car and walks towa Jack.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me bud? All you did was sleep last night.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I didn’t get back to sleep after I woke up. I had a nightmare, man.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Next thing you’re gonna do is tell me you're wetting your bed. Nightmares... Ha!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Quentin, shut up... Quentin surveys Jacks face and sees he is not happy. He t to cheer him up.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Jack, you were a cop, buddy! No nightmare can scare you that bad. We saw much worse things on the force together. I know you did, killer. Quentin nudges Jack with his elbow and chuckles. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is visually displeased. His facial expression reads disgust. He pushes Quentin’s arm down.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Just stop.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, Jacky boy? Quentin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let’s just finish packing and go. Jack starts to walk away from Quentin and help with the packing.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Let’s get a move on. Jack, Joe and Trevor all roll their eyes as they finish packing the last of the car up. Quentin walks up to the drivers seat and honks the horn.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: That’s everything. The guys start walking to get into the car as Joe closes trunk of the car. Jack climbs into the passenger seat as Trevor gets into t back seat. Joe gets into the back seat shortly after. The car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DESERT- DAY
dialogues.text: We see a WIDE SHOT of the car driving through a bare dese INT. QUENTIN’S CAR - DAY Quentin is driving his car. Jack is riding shotgun. Trevo and Joe are in the back seat. The car is packed up with a the camping gear. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I’m glad we all had time to go on this trip and spend time together. It’s been a while.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Eh, you know how it is. Going through a divorce isn’t the easiest of things. Especially if you have a kid.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Yup, before you two split up Marcy never would have let you come out to hang with the boys.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh and why is that? Quentin makes a whip sound effect with his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: How old is Kendra now?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She’s 12.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: She is the sweetest little girl.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Takes after her mom. Quentin makes a whip sound effect with his mouth. Jack shoots him a glare. Quentin smiles a stupid grin. Trevor and Joe laugh. Jack turns his head away from Quentin.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s put on some music.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Go for it, DJ. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack reaches to turn on the radio. His hand freezes. He notices that the clock on the car reads 13:13.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: You gonna put on some music or what?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Super funny guys. Who keeps messing with all the clocks?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s just in some type of weird time again.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s 13:13 brotha, so what?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I dunno, it’s just a little odd, man. Same time as on my watch at the campfire.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Law of attraction. Jack notices some road kill on the road.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Road Kill. Look out.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Good call. Quentin swerves the car and hits it.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two points! Jack looks disgusted. Joe And Trevor laugh. EXT. JACK’S HOUSE - DAY Jack, Trevor, Joe and Quentin walk towards the house carr camping gear. Kendra is seen outside sitting in the grass, cupping her hands together. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, darlin. Whatcha got in your hands?

dialogues.speaker: KENDRA
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is mommy inside? Kendra nods. The guys all say hi to Kendra while passing

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Hey Kendra.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Howdy Kendra.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Kendra. Kendra smiles at everyone. She looks tired. The guys all into the house. Kendra opens her hands. Inside her hands is a spider. She looks at it crawl on her hand for a couple seconds before squashing it in her hand. She then takes the dead spider eats it. INT. JACK’S HOUSE- KITCHEN- DAY Jack and the guys enter the kitchen. The guys take a seat the table in the kitchen. Marcy is standing at the sink, it looks like she is washi dishes. She is muttering to herself.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey Honey! Marcy doesn’t acknowledge him. Jack is visibly upset but quickly shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys want anything?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I’ll take a brew.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Alright, anyone else? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Right here. Jack starts walks towards the fridge and opens it up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You guys want a lager?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Yessir. Jack tosses Quentin a beer.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Same here. Jack tosses Trevor a beer and Joe a beer.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Thanks brotha. Jack walks back to the table with the guys and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Marcy, come join us. There is no answer from Marcy. Jack turns to look back at Marcy. She is still doing what looks like washing the dis

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcy come sit down with us. There is still no answer.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcy?

dialogues.speaker: MARCY
dialogues.text: In a minute! Just got to finish this. It just won’t come off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s okay, hun. Jack turns to look at the guys.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s a bit of a workaholic. Are ya'll staying for dinner? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The guys all look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah we will. If you’1ll have us.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Quentin, we got a long ride ahead of us back home.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Joe, lock it up. Jack begins to tune out Joe and Quentin’s bickering. Jack zoning out just staring at them. Quentin shoves Joe and i knocks over Joe’s beer. Jack looks down at his arms resting on the table. His wri watch reads 13:13 again. The beer spills across his arms slowly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What the hell, guys.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: I’m real sorry Jack. Let me clean that up for you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s fine. I'll go get some paper towels. Jack starts walking towards the sink where Marcy is.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hun, where do we keep the paper towels? His wife is muttering to herself louder. Jack pauses and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcy, what are you saying? She mutters again.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcy? She continues muttering.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marce? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts walking towards her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCY
dialogues.text: It just wont come off! Jack stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What wont come off, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: IT JUST WONT COME OFF
dialogues.text: She goes back to muttering “It just won’t come off.” To herself over and over again. Jack starts walking towards again.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Marcy it’s fine, leave the dishes alone. I’1l do them. She continues muttering to herself. Jack comes up behind her and grabs her by her waist and kisses her on her cheek, never once looking down.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about the dishes Marcy, everything is going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: MARCY
dialogues.text: It just wont come off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What wont? Jack looks down over Marcy’s shoulder into the sink. Horrified, he sees that she has completely scratched off of the skin on her arm. He lets go of her and gasps. She continues scratching her and muttering “It Just wont come off.” To her self.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcy, stop!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? Jack quickly tries to pull Marcy’s unaffected arm away fr her bloody arm in an attempt to make her stop scratching herself. He quickly grabs a nearby wash cloth and wraps i around the wound. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Call an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Just call a fucking ambulance! Marcy starts thrashing and struggling trying to make Jack go of her. Jack wraps his arms around her and holds her tight so she can’t struggle anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is chasing after a hospital gurney carrying Marcy. Doctors are huddled around the gurney checking her vitals A Doctor turns around and looks at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: GURNEY DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Sir, you are going to have to wait here.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: But that’s my wife.

dialogues.speaker: GURNEY DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I understand, sir, but you are going to have to wait here. Someone will come and get you in a moment. The doctors wheel Marcy away as Jack is left standing in hallway watching them push her away. INT. JACK’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Trevor, Quentin, and Joe are all sitting in the living ro

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Shit! Who is watching Kendra?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Methinks you should be! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Methinks you are an asshole. Trevor gets up and starts walking towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Methinks you should grab me a fucking beer while you are up. Trevor looks annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!? Quentin shoots a glare at Joe.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: No one asked you Joe. Quentin turns to look at Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just get me a god damn beer!

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Go get me a mother fucking beer before I smash your fucking face in. Trevor frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is sitting in the waiting room. Many people are wait for injured friends or family members. A young man, ALEX, is getting rowdy in the waiting room. ORDERLY #1 talks to him as SECURITY #1 stands close by.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Just let me go see my fucking brother!

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: Sir, the hospital is very busy right now. We will take you to see your brother when things calm down and we know he is stable. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You don’t understand. I don’t want to know if the bastard is stable! I just need to see him now! Jack turns to look at the situation.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Sir, you need to CALM DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Fuck this! Alex tries to push past the Orderly, but the security gua restrains him. Suddenly, ORDERLY #2, taps Jack on the shoulder. Startled, Jack jumps.

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: Room #13. She is heavily sedated. Jack seems confused. Again he notices that number.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Wait. What?

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: She is in room 13... your wife. This time the information registers with Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Don’t you think it’s bad luck to have a room 13 in your hospital? The Orderly looks very angry. Off to the side we see the security guard dragging ALEX out of the waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: Look, buddy. I’ve had enough fucking bullshit for one day. Just go see your god damn wife. She is in room fucking 13. Or don’t. It’s up to you. Just get the fuck out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No need to be so rude. Jack pushes past the orderly and walks out of the waiting room.  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is walking through the ICU. Jack sees a few people w more violent injuries then others within different rooms the ICU. Some, suffering from gunshots to the head or swo through the torso are seen being wheeled by. One man suffering from 3rd degree burns over his entire b grabs Jack's arm as Jack passes by.

dialogues.speaker: BURNED GUY
dialogues.text: Help me! The burned guy lets out his last breathe and then collaps in the gurney, dead. DOCTOR PAPPAS who was wheeling the burned guy’s gurney stops and takes a deep breathe.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is everything okay, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PAPPAS
dialogues.text: That’s the 13th guy I lost today. This is the busiest day we have ever had at this hospital. Jack perks up when he hears the number 13 again.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea why?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PAPPAS
dialogues.text: Do I look like a fucking scientist or a news reporter? I’m a god damn mother fucking doctor, damnit. You don’t think I’m qualified to be a doctor? Then you wear my jacket... here. Doctor Pappas takes off his doctor jacket and tries to ha it to Jack but Jack backs away. While backing away Jack b into a gurney behind him. Jack turns around to see a dead woman with the number 13 carved into her forehead. The doctor that was attending t her pulls the covers over her lifeless face. Jack keeps walking. He sees another doctor leaving a room This is DOCTOR PALUMBO.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Excuse me doctor. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PALUMBO
dialogues.text: What do you need? I’m really busy...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where is room 13? Doctor Palumbo surveys Jack.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PALUMBO
dialogues.text: Why do you need to know?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: My wife... she is badly injured. She’s in room 13.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PALUMBO
dialogues.text: What makes her so special?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PALUMBO
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened to her? I don’t got all day.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She scratched off all the skin on her arm. Doctor Palumbo laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s so funny?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PALUMBO
dialogues.text: You’re on the wrong floor, Jackass. This level is for critical patients, not suicidal retards.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Jack is doing his best not to get angry.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR PALUMBO
dialogues.text: Floor three. Take the elevator to your right. Or you can take the stairs. Up to you. Now get out of my sight. I got work to do, dumbass. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack puts his head down and quickly walks to the elevator enters it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack presses level three in the elevator. He stands there the elevator goes up. He is in the elevator alone. He is doing his best to hold himself together and remain strong is visibly upset. The elevator gets to level three and opens. Jack exits th elevator quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks out of the elevator into Level 3 of the hospit There are a bunch of hospital rooms but it looks a lot mo calm. Jack walks through the floor looking at the door numbers. then spots a FEMALE RECEPTIONIST. Jack walks up to the receptionist. She is writing on something at her desk. Jack stands in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: My wife is in room 13. Do you know where that is? The receptionist looks up at Jack and points to room 13. turns to look at where she is pointing and sees room 13. 14's door is slightly open, just enough that you can see inside.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Its right over there. The receptionist goes back to looking at a schedule on he desk that she is writing on.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thanks. I was beginning to think everyone in this hospital was an asshole. The receptionist looks back at Jack and glares.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Only you are sir. She then looks back down at her schedule. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Never mind. Everyone in this hospital is an asshole. Jack turns and walks to his wife’s room. He stands in fro of it for a moment and takes a deep breathe. Jack turns to look at the slightly open door of the room to him. Inside the room he can see a a beautiful woman, CANDACE sitting down next to a hospital bed and leaning o it. In the bed is an unconscious young boy, JIMMY [9]. Jack looks at them for a couple of seconds. He then turns back to the door of his wife’s room. Jack stares at the 1 the door for a couple of seconds then puts his hand on th doorknob. He shakes his head and enters the room. The doo closes slowly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM 13- DAY
dialogues.text: Jack walks into the room, locking the door behind him. In hospital bed, Marcy is laying there heavily sedated. She motionless. Jack turns around and locks the door behind him. He then walks over to his wife and kisses her on the forehead wit long and lingering kiss. He then walks over to the armcha next to her and sits down. Tired and overwhelmed by everything he has seen today, Jack begins to drift off in light sleep. INT. JACK’S LIVING ROOM Joe and Quentin both crack open a brand new beer as they in front of the television laughing. Over their shoulders, through the window, Trevor can be s outside watching Kendra. Quentin turns around and looks b at Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: He’s a regular Mary Poppins ain't he? Joe laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Yup.  21.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM 13- DAY
dialogues.text: Jacks POV: Jack opens his eyes a little and sees his wife still asleep in the bed in front of him. He slowly closes eyes making the SCREEN go black. He has drifted off into slumber. INT. JACK’S LIVING ROOM - DREAM WORLD Jack slowly opens his eyes. He is no longer in the hospit bedroom. Instead he is standing in his living room, howev it doesn’t look like his living room. The paint on the wa is slightly peeling and smeared in blood. On the walls ar three giant 13's. The strangest thing Jack sees is Candace, the woman who w in the room next door, standing in the center of his livi room and crying. dialogues.text: Candace is putting a blanket over her nephew’s dead body. INT. CANDACE’S HOSPITAL ROOM -DAY Candace has finished talking about what had happened with nephew. She cradles a makeshift bandage on her arm as Jac listens to her speak intently.

dialogues.speaker: ACT 5
dialogues.text: INT. CANDACE’S HOSPITAL ROOM -DAY Candace is sitting in the chair in the room while Jack pa back and forth. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: Quentin has finished loading his gun. Furious about the l of the static on the TV and annoyed by the sound, he poin his gun at the TV and shoots it. INT. CANDACE’S HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY Candace is sitting down as Jack paces back and forth throughout the hospital room.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That number...

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: What number? Jack walks over to the Thermostat and fixes it while talk

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: 13. Everywhere I fucking look I see a 13. Clocks, dreams, walls, room numbers, and now a freaking thermostat? We don’t even use Celsius in America! Candaces eyes flicker.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: That’s because today 13/13/13

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s what? The doorknob of the room starts to jiggle.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you mean it’s 13/13/13

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: You wont believe me if I tried to explain.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: At this point, I’d believe just about anything. The crazy people start banging on the Door even more.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Do you think that door is going to hold?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s not going to hold long. We need to figure out how to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Any ideas? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, we are three stories up, we cant climb down through the window. We are going to have to make a break for it through the door. Candace looks very displeased by this response. The crazy people outside are still banging on the door but it is no hard. Jack nods.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Well, there are too many people on the other side of that door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We are going to have to fight our way through.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Or we can wait them out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You're right. At least until we know they aren’t on the other side of that door. The banging on the door slows down.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: But there is no way we can know that. There is no way to see through the door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: They are slowing down. We need to get out of here! I need to get to my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: We have to wait until they stop banging. It’s getting less and less often.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Do you see anything that we can use as weapons?

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I can go rummaging through the drawers. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Candace goes towards the drawers and starts digging throu them. The banging on the door stops.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hurry up and find a weapon for us. They stopped banging!

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I'm looking. Jack notices a mirror on the wall. He looks from the mirr to the door. He notices that the door is slightly off of ground.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I found these! Candace holds up a bunch of medical supplies that could b used as weapons such as scalpels and other pointed object Jack picks up the stool he had picked up when he first ca into the room and smashes it into the mirror. Candace jumps. Jack quickly tries to silence her by putti his finger up to his own mouth making the “shh” motion.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Jack grabs a broken piece of mirror.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Getting a piece of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Why? Jack lays on his belly next to the door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: To see if the coast is clear. Jack slides the piece of mirror underneath the door. In t reflection he sees nothing. It looks like the coast is cl Suddenly a crazy person walks by the mirror and stops. Th crazy person is covered in blood and looks directly into broken piece of mirror. A loud crash is heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: CRASHMAKER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s 13 mother fucking kills! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The crazy person covered in blood turns to look in the direction of the crashmaker. After a few lingering seconds they scream loudly and run after the crashmaker. Jack turns back to Candace and look her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Coast is clear. Let’s go. Candace looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I don’t know... It’s... Jack cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm leaving this room, if you want me to protect you, you have to come with me. I need to save my daughter. I don’t want to leave you behind, but I will if I have to. INT. JACK’S LIVING ROOM -DAY Joe is pacing around the living room scratching his head the gun. Quentin is peering out of the windows. A few crazy people seen walking around outside in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: The whole fucking world has gone crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Did you see the news? People are just killing each other. He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My stomach hurts, why does my stomach hurt? He grabs his side.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why the fuck am I bleeding? Quentin whirls around and looks at Joe. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Shit! You are bleeding. What happened? Go in the kitchen and bandage that up. Joe takes his hand off of his stomach and looks at the bl on his hand.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joe, go bandage it up. You are bleeding bad. Joe just stares blankly at his hand. Quentin lifts his gu and points it at Joe.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joe! Fucking respond to me when I goddamn talk to you, you fuck! Go bandage that shit up before I fucking shoot you. Joe shakes himself out of staring at his hand and looks a Quentin.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Keep it the fuck down! We don’t want those crazy fucks to hear you. And it’s fine. I’1l bandage it later. It’s not a big deal. Just shut your mouth. Quentin cocks his gun.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Boy don’t you ever tell me what to do! I know you are my brother but you don’t get a pass for that. You understand? Joe nods.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We clear?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Crystal. There is an awkward pause as Quentin starts to shake with anger.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you going to put the gun down? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Not until we are clear.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: I just said we were clear.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I wasn’t paying attention. Say it again!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Say it the fuck again!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Keep it down. They’1ll hear us. It’s like you don’t even care.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: You know what? You’re right! I don’t even care. Quentin spins around and fires his gun through the window the distance a crazy woman hears the gunshot and starts walking towards the house. Quentin turns around and looks at Joe.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look alive, soldier! Joe rushes up next to Quentin. Suddenly on a different window, off to the side, a woman starts banging her head one of the windows repeatedly until it breaks. Joe quickly turns and shoots her in the head, blowing the of her head clean off.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: I got one!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I am proud of you, private!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: I’m about as proud of you as your girlfriend was the day you got your redwings, soldier. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Just happy to be in the battalion, captain. Joe does a salute. Quentin turns to look at Joe and quickly turns back to pe through the blinds in the window outside. He waves Joe’s down without looking.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: At ease, soldier. More people are seen running toward the house in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have a group of hostiles trying to ambush our base. Now our right and left flank are protected but we have to guard the front. We don’t know what they are capable of. One of the crazy people, whom are quickly approaching, fi a gun and it misses.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And they have weapons. We gotta board these window up and protect the club house! Quentin and Joe begin to start the process of boarding up the windows.

dialogues.speaker: ACT 6
dialogues.text: INT. CANDACE’S HOSPITAL ROOM -DAY Jack is pressed up against the wall on one side of the do with Candace pressed up against the wall on the other sid the door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay... On the count of three I am going to open this door. If anyone comes in you slam the door behind them. We got to take them out one by one.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: And what if no one comes in. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Then we have to make a break for it. There are three levels of this hospital we have to clear. Candace looks nervous. Jack doesn’t look much better but he is trying to hold it together to be a leader and get them through this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Will I ever be?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good point. Candace frowns.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I’m going to protect you.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Because you saved my ass back there. Candace smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay. One. Candace tenses up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two. Jack leans in towards the door and put’s his hand on the knob. He shivers. His eyes dart back to the Thermostat. It’s 13 degrees Celsius again. He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just fixed that thing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: What thing?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The Thermostat! It’s fuckin 13 degrees again. I’m tired of all these fucking 13’s everywhere! Candace starts backing away from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you backing away from me.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: You're going crazy. Jack takes a moment to calm himself down.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I just am tired of seeing all these 13’s everywhere all the time.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I know why you are seeing 13's everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I know. You told me. It’s 13/13/13.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: It’s important.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: 13/13/13. The end of the world. It exists only due to a problem within the Julian calendar, leap year wasn't meant to add an extra day to the month of February but ever 120 years it was meant to add an extra month, ‘Murtembre’ to the entire calendar. By mathematics, today is 13/13/13 the real prediction in the Mayan calendar of the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How do you know all that? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I’m kind of a calendar nerd, because of my birthday. Jack laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well it’s not like I’m gonna get a better explanation from anyone else anyway. Candace smiles a little.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, you're telling me that February 29th was never suppose to exist?

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Just my luck, my birthday was never suppose to exist.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: You were born on leap year?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes, I was. I’m only 10 years old. Candace laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Well I’m younger.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Yea. I was born on leap year too.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’ve never met another leap year baby before.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Me either. They both smile.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Do you think that’s why we aren't affected by this? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Single... coolest... birthday... ever! They both smile again.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m ready. Jack nods.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Three! Jack swings open the door. They wait a few seconds. Nothi happens. Jack peeks his head outside of the door and looks around. Nothing is out there. He turns back to look at Candace.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright. Coast is clear. Let’s go. Suddenly a hand reaches and grabs Jack by the hair. Jack jumps and pulls the person into the room with him, reveal it is the young man, ALEX, from earlier. Alex is holding onto Jack. Jack falls backwards onto the ground and Alex get’s on top of him. Jack turns to look a Candace who is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Candace, close the door. She tries to close the door but Alex’s legs and Jack’s le are in the way.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m going to fuckin’ kill you for what you made me do to my brother, you bastard.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Candace, close the door!

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Your legs are blocking it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack tries to move his legs but Alex punches Jack in the face. Jack reaches up with his hand holding the scalpel. swings his arm trying to connect with Alex’s throat or he Alex quickly blocks Jack's arm knocking the blade onto th ground. Jack reaches for it but it is just out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Naughty naughty! That’s just no fun. I don’t like guns or knives, my hands are more personal.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Candace... a little help! Alex wraps his hands around Jack’s throat strangling him. Candace runs up behind Alex and stabs him in the back wit scalpel. Alex reaches behind himself to grab the scalpel.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You stabbed me, bitch? Alex reaches down and grabs Candace’s leg, making her fal the ground. She bumps her head a little but nothing serio Jack has managed to wiggle loose while Alex's focus is on Candace. He has gotten his knees up to his own chest.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Leave her alone. Alex pulls the scalpel out of his back and raises it in t air like he is about to stab Candace.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This is for stabbing me, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Leave her alone or I’1l kill you! Alex whirls his head around to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What did you just say to me? Alex leans in close and puts the scalpel towards Jack’s f Jack smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That if you don’t leave her alone I am going to kill you. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alex looks furious. He makes a motion like he is about to Jack. But Jack has prepared for this and launches Alex ba with his knees that he had tucked under Alex’s chest. Alex flies backwards and falls on his back. Jack scramble after him. Jack pushes Alex down while getting on top of him. Alex h the scalpel in his hand still, but is slightly stunned. Alex’s head is right in the middle of the doorway. His ar with the scalpel is pinned down by Jack but is wiggling t get free. Alex’s arm manages to get free. He swings his arm towards Jack but Jack blocks it, wrist to wrist, and grabs the do Jack takes the door and slams it on Alex’s head. Alex’s a fall to the ground. Jack repeatedly slams the door on Alex’s head until it is smashed entirely open. Blood has spurted up and drenched in it.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: He’s dead, Jack. Jack stops slamming the door on Alex’s head and turns to at Candace.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good. Candace looks forward and sees this floor of the hospital looks empty.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Let's go. Jack stands up, he grabs the dropped weapons and leaves t room with Candace closely following behind.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood drenches the hallway. Some screams are heard throug the hospital, echoing and bouncing off the walls, no way triangulate its origin. One of the overhead lights is flickering. Jack and Candace slowly walk out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Keep close behind me.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Okay. Jack and Candace tiptoe through the third floor of the hospital. Some dead bodies litter the scenery. The receptionist is dead with her throat cut. Jack walks slowly as he approaches the first open door. H waves for Candace to hold position and not follow him in. presses his body against the side of the doorway and poke his head around the corner to see if the room is clear. H turns his head and surveys the room. Other then a dead bo on the ground the room is clear of people. Jack takes a deep breath and detaches himself from his wa cover. He turns to look at Candace.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This room is clear. Jack turns away from Candace and starts moving through th hallway more. He waves for Candace to follow him and she does, sticking close to his heels. She clutches the scalp tightly in her hand. In front of Jack, one room ahead, he sees a fire axe.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need a better weapon. After I clear this room, cover me and I'1l get that axe.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Okay. Jack slides his body up against the doorway of the next r He peers around the edge of the doorway into the room and surveys it. The room is still, but dark. All the blinds a closed. Jack turns his head slowly. The room is clear muc his surprise. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Clear. Jack and Candace rush up to the fire axe. Jack grabs the and moves to the next door. It’s closed. Jack breathes a of relief.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This one’s closed. Only a few more till we get to the elevator. Jack and Candace move to the next door. It is slightly aj Jack presses his body up against the wall next to the doorway. Jack uses the axe to push the door open. He looks in and surveys the room. There is a lot of blood on the sheets b no body. Jack turns his head and checks the corner of the wall. Standing there, pressed up against the wall, much like Ja is MEREDITH, she has an amazing body but is wearing the f of some man she has killed as a mask. She screams and lun at Jack. Jack takes a step back and swings the axe but misses Meredith. She knocks Jack over and gets on top of him. He drops the axe. She is holding a pocket knife in her hand is already bloody. She takes off the face mask revealing own face, which is covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: I’m going to make myself a new mask. She moves her knife towards Jack’s face.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Get off of me. Jack starts to wiggle.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Hold still! It’s not going to come out right if you keep moving! Suddenly Meredith gets hit in the back with a fire axe. Candace is revealed standing behind her. She lets go of t axe which is still lodged in Meredith’s back. Meredith stands up slowly. She tries to reach the axe on back but can’t. Her arms flail, trying. Jack stands up an looks at her for a few moments. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack walks towards Meredith who is still trying to get th axe out of her back. She is screaming in pain. Jack puts his foot on her back and presses forward while pulling the axe out. Meredith falls to the ground when th axe dislodges from her back. Jack quickly swings the axe and hits her in the back of t head with it, killing her instantly. A pool of blood surrounds her. Jack pulls the axe out of the top of Meredith’s head. He picks up Meredith’s knife and puts it in his pocket. Jack then turns to look at Candace, who seems a bit queas from what she has just seen.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thanks for saving me.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: We're in this together, right?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Right. Let’s get in the elevator and get out of here. Jack and Candace quickly approach the elevator and press button. It opens up and they get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Candace are standing in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Well, what floor?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ground level. Candace reaches to press the button and presses it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! Jack hits the stop button for the elevator. A loud buzz i heard and the elevator stays still.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need a plan first. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Ground level?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is your car parked?

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: I came here in an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shit. Jack looks upset.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: What? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So did I. Candace grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Then how are we going to get out of this hospital and over to your house? We sure as hell can’t do it on our feet.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let me think. Candace stands there eagerly waiting.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got it. We need to get a bag. And collect the car keys from all of the dead doctor’s pockets. Candace looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Why’s that? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Because if they are doctors then that means they drove to work. Their cars must be in the parking garage.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Alright. Sounds good to me. Candace reaches to turn the elevator back on.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hit floor 3. Candace pauses and turns to look at Jack very confused.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Because we should take the stairs. Not only do we have a lot of keys to collect but also I think we should go through the hospital on foot.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Um, why? That’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No crazier then going onto a level we haven’t even checked out. What if the doors open and there are over a hundred people down there? We would be trapped. We have to sneak through the hospital and avoid them.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Level three it is. Candace hits the stop button and unstops the elevator. Sh then hits Level 3 on the elevator and the elevator doors open. Jack and Candace slowly exit the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL HALLWAY LEVEL 3- DAY
dialogues.text: Jack and Candace emerge from the elevator. Jack turns and looks around. He see’s the staircase. He holds for a seco and then turns back to where the receptionist is. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m going to get the keys out of that receptionist’s pocket, then we are going to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Look for a bag over there, just in case we need to grab a bunch of them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good thinking. Here, hold on to this. Jack hands Candace the fire axe.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Why.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I already know that side of the hospital floor is safe. If anyone comes your way, you are gonna need to be able to defend yourself.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Or save your ass for the third time. Jack smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Or that. Anyway, if too many of them come get into the elevator and put it on hold like I did before. You'll be safe in there. Candace smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Well, what about you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. I got the knife that woman dropped. Jack reaches into his pocket and pulls out the knife.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See. Candace smiles while clutching the axe. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: You sure you wouldn’t rather have a scalpel? Jack laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Alright. I’m off. Jack runs over to the dead body of the receptionist sitti at the desk. He grabs the receptionist and pulls her back

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about this. He then reaches into the pocket, he feels nothing. He rea into the other pocket. There is still nothing. Jack looks back towards Candace. Jack shakes his head. Candace thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Well, did you check her purse? Jack feels like an idiot, as if he should have thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No. I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Well, check it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, where would her purse be?

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Under her desk maybe? Jack looks underneath the desk. There is a trash can.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: There’s only a trash can. Candace thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Well, are there any drawers? Jack sees a drawer on the desk and opens it up. It just h bunch of papers in it. He closes it back up. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED

dialogues.text: Sure. Maybe it’s unaffected.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: True. Jacks smiles a half smile and stares out the window of th car. Jack is breathing hard. He begins doing something wi the window.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I guess...

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Who knows. Maybe they at least have some leap year babies over there. Jack laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Maybe.... Candace notices Jack drawing something on the window.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE
dialogues.text: Were gonna be okay now Jack. Jack stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We made it. There is no response. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jack what were you doing back there? Candace turns around to look into the back seat of the ca Jack looks like he is sleeping in the back seat. Candace surveys him. He looks pail and is clutching the w on his stomach. He has lost a lot of blood.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jack! There is still no answer.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jack, wake up! Jack does not respond. Candace reaches over to shake Jack She shakes his body a little.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jack! There is still no response. She reaches over to check his vitals. She holds for a couple seconds. A look of pure anguish strikes her face. She can’t get a pulse. She begi to cry.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Jack... Her eyes trace Jack from his wound up to his face. Behind head are some smudges on the window. She looks at them. I a stick figure family drawn in blood, of a man and a litt girl.

dialogues.speaker: CANDACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh Jack.... Candace begins to scream in agony and has a complete melt in the car. After a few moments she manages to pull herse together.
